number.description:
required if
- `type`==`dynamic_gbp` (gbp_tag received from RADIUS)
- `type`==`static_gbp` (applying gbp tag against matching conditions)

list.description:
required if 
- `type`==`mac`
- `type`==`static_gbp` if from matching mac

string.description:
if:
- `type`==`mac` (optional. default is `any`)
- `type`==`subnet` (optional. default is `any`)
- `type`==`network`
- `type`==`resource` (optional. default is `any`)
- `type`==`static_gbp` if from matching network (vlan)

required if 
- `type`==`radius_group` 
- `type`==`static_gbp` if from matching radius_group
`tcp` / `udp` / `icmp` / `gre` / `any` / `:protocol_number`. `protocol_number` is between 1-254

list_nested.description:
if `type`==`resource`
empty means unrestricted, i.e. any

list.description:
if 
- `type`==`subnet` 
- `type`==`resource` (optional. default is `any`)
- `type`==`static_gbp` if from matching subnet

map_nested.description: ACL Tags to identify traffic source or destination. Key name is the tag name

bool.description: Enable for dynamic ARP inspection check
Enable for check for forging source IP address

list.description: if `all_networks`==`false`, list of network with DHCP snooping enabled
Org Networks that we'd like to import

bool.description: if `mode`==`trunk`, whether to trunk all network/vlans

if DHCP snooping is enabled, whether DHCP server is allowed on the interfaces with. All the interfaces from port configs using this port usage are effected. Please notice that allow_dhcpd is a tri-state.

When it is not defined, it means using the systemâ€™s default setting which depends on whether the port is a access or trunk port.
if `port_auth`==`dot1x`, bypass auth for known clients if set to true when RADIUS server is down
if `port_auth`=`dot1x`, bypass auth for all (including unknown clients) if set to true when RADIUS server is down

string.description: description

bool.description: if speed and duplex are specified, whether to disable autonegotiation

string.description: link connection mode, choices are auto (default), full, and half

list.description: if dynamic vlan is used, specify the possible networks/vlans RADIUS can return

bool.description: if `port_auth`==`dot1x`, whether to enable MAC Auth

string.description: if `port_auth`==`dot1x`, which network to put the device into if the device cannot do dot1x. default is null (i.e. not allowed)
if `enable_mac_auth` ==`true`. This type is ignored if mist_nac is enabled.

int64.description: max number of mac addresses, default is 0 for unlimited, otherwise range is 1 or higher, with upper bound constrained by platform

string.description: access (default) / trunk

int64.description: media maximum transmission unit (MTU) is the largest data unit that can be forwarded without fragmentation. The default value is 1514.

bool.description: if `mode`==`access` and `port_auth`!=`dot1x`, whether the port should retain dynamically learned MAC addresses
whether PoE capabilities are disabled for a port

string.description: if dot1x is desired, set to dot1x
native network/vlan for untagged traffic
if `port_auth`==`dot1x`, when radius server reject / fails
speed, default is auto to automatically negotiate speed

bool.description: whether to disable storm control on broadcast traffic
whether to disable storm control on multicast traffic
whether to disable storm control on registered multicast traffic
whether to disable storm control on unknown unicast traffic

int64.description: bandwidth-percentage, configures the storm control level as a percentage of the available bandwidth

bool.description: when enabled, the port is not expected to receive BPDU frames

string.description: network/vlan for voip traffic, must also set port_network. to authenticate device, set port_auth

map_nested.description: Property key is the port profile name

int64.description: how frequently should interim accounting be reported, 60-65535. default is 0 (use one specified in Access-Accept request from RADIUS Server). Very frequent messages can affect the performance of the radius server, 600 and up is recommended when enabled

string.description: ip / hostname of RADIUS server
secret of RADIUS server
ip / hostname of RADIUS server
secret of RADIUS server

use `network`or `source_ip`
which network the RADIUS server resides, if there's static IP for this network, we'd use it as source-ip
use `network`or `source_ip`
if source_address is configured, will use the vlan firstly otherwise use source_ip
if source_address is configured, will use the vlan firstly otherwise use source_ip

view name here should be defined in views above
<refer to notify tag, can be multiple with blank
refer to notify target parameters name
refer to profile-name in notify-filter
refer to security_name in usm
required only if `engine_type`==`remote_engine`

include alphabetic, numeric, and special characters, but it cannot include control characters.
sha224, sha256, sha384, sha512 are supported in 21.1 and newer release

Not required if `encryption_type`==`privacy-none`
include alphabetic, numeric, and special characters, but it cannot include control characters
only required if `type`==`context_prefix`
refer to view name

refer to view name
refer to group_name under access

bool.description: if the root oid configured is included

string.description: matched dst port, "0" means any

bool.description:
when enabled, all traffic that is not essential to our operation will be dropped
e.g. ntp / dns / traffic to mist will be allowed by default
     if dhcpd is enabled, we'll make sure it works

single_nested.description:
restrict inbound-traffic to host
when enabled, all traffic that is not essential to our operation will be dropped 
e.g. ntp / dns / traffic to mist will be allowed by default, if dhcpd is enabled, we'll make sure it works

string.description: which network the TACACS server resides
Next-hop address

map_nested.description: Property key is the destination CIDR (e.g. "10.0.0.0/8")
Property key is the VRF name
